            "@value": "The following article is inserted:
‘Article 28a
Derogations applicable in advance of the implementation by 2020 of an international agreement applying a single global market-based measure
1.   By way of derogation from Articles 2(3) and 4, this Directive shall not apply to flights which, but for this paragraph, would fall within the scope of those Articles if:
(a) they are performed by aircraft operators established in third countries;
(b) they take off or land at aerodromes located in third countries; and
(c) they do not involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in a Member State.
2.   By way of derogation from Article 5, the provisions of that Article shall apply to flights referred to in paragraph 1 only if:
(a) they are performed by aircraft operators established in third countries;
(b) they involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in a Member State; and
(c) they do not involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in another third country.
3.   By way of derogation from Article 6, the provisions of that Article shall apply to flights referred to in paragraph 1 only if:
(a) they are performed by aircraft operators established in third countries;
(b) they involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in a Member State; and
(c) they do not involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in another third country.
4.   By way of derogation from Article 7, the provisions of that Article shall apply to flights referred to in paragraph 1 only if:
(a) they are performed by aircraft operators established in third countries;
(b) they involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in a Member State; and
(c) they do not involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in another third country.
5.   By way of derogation from Article 8, the provisions of that Article shall apply to flights referred to in paragraph 1 only if:
(a) they are performed by aircraft operators established in third countries;
(b) they involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in a Member State; and
(c) they do not involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in another third country.
6.   By way of derogation from Article 9, the provisions of that Article shall apply to flights referred to in paragraph 1 only if:
(a) they are performed by aircraft operators established in third countries;
(b) they involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in a Member State; and
(c) they do not involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in another third country.
7.   By way of derogation from Article 10, the provisions of that Article shall apply to flights referred to in paragraph 1 only if:
(a) they are performed by aircraft operators established in third countries;
(b) they involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in a Member State; and
(c) they do not involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in another third country.
8.   By way of derogation from Article 11, the provisions of that Article shall apply to flights referred to in paragraph 1 only if:
(a) they are performed by aircraft operators established in third countries;
(b) they involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in a Member State; and

9.   By way of derogation from Article 12, the provisions of that Article shall apply to flights referred to in paragraph 1 only if:
(a) they are performed by aircraft operators established in third countries;
(b) they involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in a Member State; and
(c) they do not involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in another third country.
10.   By way of derogation from Article 13, the provisions of that Article shall apply to flights referred to in paragraph 1 only if:
(a) they are performed by aircraft operators established in third countries;
(b) they involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in a Member State; and
(c) they do not involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in another third country.
11.   By way of derogation from Article 14, the provisions of that Article shall apply to flights referred to in paragraph 1 only if:
(a) they are performed by aircraft operators established in third countries;
(b) they involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in a Member State; and
(c) they do not involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in another third country.

47.   By way of derogation from Article 50, the provisions of that Article shall apply to flights referred to in paragraph 1 only if:

(c) they do not involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in another third country.

It seems like this is a repetitive statement for each article. Is there a more concise way to express this?
Certainly! You can consolidate the repetitive statements into a single, general clause that applies to all articles. Here's a more concise version:

---

By way of derogation from Articles 1 through 50, the provisions of each Article shall apply to flights referred to in paragraph 1 only if:
(a) they are performed by aircraft operators established in third countries;
(b) they involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in a Member State; and
(c) they do not involve any landing or take-off at an aerodrome located in another third country.

---

This version clearly states the conditions that apply to all articles from 1 through 50 without repeating the same text for each one.
